授業目的:
Students will be introduced to a wide range of communication strategies at the intermediate level. The course will emphasize speaking, listening, reading, and writing.

The purpose of this course is for students to continue practicing and improving speaking and listening fluency, communication skills, presentations skills, acquire vocabulary, and explore personal and social issues in society using English as a medium to communicate student ideas and opinions. The course will focus on the further development of student communicative competency, vocabulary, grammar, listening, speaking, reading, critical thinking, comprehension, writing, and discussion. The course will be conducted in English.

By the end of the course, students should be able to reflect upon, discuss, and share their points of view about a variety of topics at a level higher than first semester, intermediate instead of basic, about a variety of daily conversation topics. Students should improve medium length conversations better.
到達目標:
Using the textbook Time Zones 3B (Third Edition), students will be able to improve their English communication and conversation skills.

By the end of the course, students will be able to:

1. Improve speaking and listening skills through conversations on a variety of daily life topics.
2. Learn about jobs and career choices, use language for talking about goals, and find out about interesting and extreme jobs.
3. Learn how to talk about people, use language for identifying and describing people, and find out about heroes and inspirational people.
4. Learn about the plastic problem, use language for talking about rules, and find out different ways society can help reduce plastic waste.
5. Find out about animals and how they do things, learn how to describe characteristics and behavior, and explore how animals can be kind to each other.
6. Find out about how climate change affects the planet, learn language for making predictions, and explore ways to fight climate change.
7. Gain confidence to express opinions related to these topics.
8. Develop critical thinking skills.
9. Develop skills for academic writing.
10. Learn basic technology skills such as e-mailing and making an audio or video recording on their computer or smartphone.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: Classes will have the instructor introduce the topic, an activity to help students prepare for the topic(s) described in the book, a series of activities, and the class will conclude with students being able to share their own ideas. The focus of this class is vocabulary, speaking, grammar, listening and reading.  In each lesson, students will develop their ability to communicate in English by speaking in pairs or in small groups.  The content of the lesson is based on the textbook, but students will sometimes participate in extra communication activities.  Students should be prepared for frequent discussion activities, in which they will learn and practice appropriate language for a range of communication situations (for example: asking for opinions, expressing opinions, disagreeing, offering advice, persuading others, etc.). Students will be expected to participate in an 'English only' learning environment.
授業方法: We will be a face-to-face class. A face-to-face class format is defined as 50% of the course’s total contact hours are at the minimum conducted in a face-to-face manner. Also, the number of people allowed in a classroom must be limited to half of its usual capacity. When activity restriction levels are 1 or 2, we'll be face-to-face. When activity restriction levels are 3 and higher, we'll be doing zoom simultaneous/two way online (in real time). Let’s try to have as many face-to-face classes as possible.
